textBeforeTable: Country ranking Country comparison Thematic map See also: Source: World Bank, International Debt Statistics. Definition: Bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Principal repayments are actual amounts of principal (amortization) paid by the borrower in currency, goods, or services in the year specified. Data are in current U.S. dollars. The latest value for PPG, bilateral (AMT, current US$) in Lesotho was $8,139,000 as of 2014. Over the past 44 years, the value for this indicator has fluctuated between $23,276,000 in 2001 and $32,000 in 1974. textAfterTable: 2014 $8,139,000 PPG, bilateral concessional (AMT, current US$) The latest value for PPG, bilateral concessional (AMT, current US$) in Lesotho was $5,847,000 as of 2013. Over the past 43 years, the value for this indicator has fluctuated between $22,192,000 in 2001 and $11,000 in 1974. Definition: Bilateral debt includes loans from governments and their agencies (including central banks), loans from autonomous bodies, and direct loans from official export credit agencies. Concessional debt is defined as loans with an original grant element of 25 percent or more. The grant element of a loan is the grant equivalent expressed as a percentage of
